headline: Is Sherwin-Williams (SHW) Pricing Reflect Long-Term Potential After Recent Share Price Rebound
summary: If you have been wondering whether Sherwin-Williams at around US$348.52 is a fair deal or a stretch, this breakdown is aimed at helping you frame that question clearly. The stock has seen mixed returns, with a 7.1% gain over the last 30 days and a 6.3% return year to date, while the 1 year return is a 2.4% decline and the 3 year and 5 year returns sit at 56.7% and 58.0% respectively. Recent share price moves sit against a backdrop of ongoing interest in Sherwin-Williams as a major coatings...

headline: Assessing Sherwin-Williams (SHW) Valuation After Fresh Citi And RBC Confidence Boost
summary: Recent commentary from Citi and RBC Capital has put Sherwin-Williams (SHW) back in focus, highlighting an elevated housing outlook through 2027, planned restructuring cost savings, and continued execution on price increases. See our latest analysis for Sherwin-Williams. The recent Citi and RBC commentary comes as Sherwin-Williams trades at US$348.52, with a 30-day share price return of 7.12% and a year-to-date share price return of 6.31%. Its 5-year total shareholder return of 58.01%...

headline: Deutsche Bank downgrades Sherwin-Williams to Hold on valuation
summary: Deutsche Bank analyst David Begleiter last night downgraded Sherwin-Williams (SHW) to Hold from Buy with a price target of $380, down from $390. The firm says the Sherwin’s valuation as fair at slightly above its historical five-year averages. 2026 should mark Sherwin’s third straight year of below 10% earnings growth, the analyst tells investors in a research note.
